B. Relevant domestic law

LAW , insofar as relevant , provides that if a party to proceedings fails to comply with the prescribed time - limit through no fault of its own , the court shall , on that party ’s request , grant leave to appeal out of time .

Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure provides that the parties to proceedings are under an obligation to inform the court about any change of address . Under § CARDINAL of this provision , if they fail to do so , a decision to be served on the party shall be filed in the case - file and shall be regarded as having been duly served , unless the court knows the new address of that party .
